text: Conus armoricus is an extinct species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails, cone shells or cones.Marshall, B. (2015). Conus armoricus Suter, 1917 †. In: MolluscaBase (2015). Accessed through: World Register of Marine Species at http://www.marinespecies.org/aphia.php?p=taxdetails&id;=831754 on 2015-06-30 ==Description== ==Distribution== This species is from Miocene-aged marine environments of New Zealand. ==References== * Maxwell, P.A. (2009). Cenozoic Mollusca. pp 232–254 in Gordon, D.P. (ed.) New Zealand inventory of biodiversity. Volume one. Kingdom Animalia: Radiata, Lophotrochozoa, Deuterostomia. Canterbury University Press, Christchurch. ==External links== armoricus Category:Gastropods of New Zealand Category:Extinct animals of New Zealand Category:Gastropods described in 1917 Category:Miocene gastropods
title: Conus armoricus
